document.masterDocTitle: Mexican species of the genus Orthocentrus (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae: Orthocentrinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Mexican species of the genus Orthocentrus (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae: Orthocentrinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Orthocentrus rectus Veijalainen in
Veijalainen et al. , 2014: 216–217
[ holotype female (BMNH), ‘ Honduras , PN La Muralla,
15.09544ºN, 86.73867ºW, 1440± 10 m , cloud forest, Malaise trap, 2.–5.V.2010 , LLAMA#Ma-C- 01-2-01 ’]. https://species-id.net/wiki/ Orthocentrus _rectus

1 ♂
Tamaulipas
, Tula , Ejido Acahuales B. Quercus ,
1400 m
, MT,
11–24.IX.2016
, leg. E. Ruíz Cancino & J.M. Coronado ( UAT )
.
Distribution. Costa Rica , Nicaragua , Honduras , Guatemala , México ( Tamaulipas , Veracruz , Quintana Roo ).

Comments. Compared with the other species that have a complete posterior transverse carina and short notauli, subocular sulcus is straight, unlike in
O. luteoclypeus
and
O. maculae
. Most similar to
O. saaksjarvii
but differs in the normal-sized propodeal spiracle, scutellum less steeply sloping posteriorly, slightly broader temples, and details of the colour pattern.
